intro: Pleurothallis juninensis, commonly known as the Junín orchid, is a species of orchid native to the Andean regions of Peru. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, epiphytic growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with intricate patterns on the petals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes, often growing on tree branches or rock surfaces. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a subject of interest for botanists and orchid enthusiasts.
